diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Gallstone pancreatitis, Acute cholecystitis, Necrotic gallbladder
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Mr. ___ presented with epigastric pain, a history of gallbladder attacks, and dark urine, which led to the diagnosis of gallstone pancreatitis and acute cholecystitis. Physical examination revealed scleral icterus and tenderness in the epigastric area, supporting these diagnoses.
